TITLE: ロケット科学
GOAL_PIN_STATE_DESCRIPTION: Check if a part exists with a certain value at a certain pin.
TOOLBAR_SELECT: Select and move parts on the PCB
TOOLBAR_X_RAY: See through parts on the PCB
PIN_POWER_DESCRIPTION: This part will only work when power is supplied to this pin.
PART_LED_DESCRIPTION: Emits light when a signal is supplied to it.
PART_LED_PIN_DESCRIPTION: If a signal is supplied to this pin, the LED will light up.
PART_OSCILLATOR_DESCRIPTION: An oscillator with constantly inverting output.
PART_OSCILLATOR_PIN_1_DESCRIPTION: When this part is active, the output signal will flip from on to off and vice versa on every tick.
PART_GATE_OR_DESCRIPTION: An OR gate. Its output will be on when at least one of its two inputs is on.
PART_GATE_OR_PIN_1_DESCRIPTION: When this part is active, this pin will output a <high> signal when at least one input receives a <high> signal.
PART_GATE_XOR_DESCRIPTION: A XOR gate. Its output will be on when only one of its two inputs is on.
PART_GATE_XOR_PIN_1_DESCRIPTION: When this part is active, this pin will output a <high> signal when either input one or input two receives a <high> signal.
PART_GATE_AND_DESCRIPTION: An AND gate. Its output will be on, if and only if its two inputs are on.
PART_GATE_AND_PIN_1_DESCRIPTION: When this part is active, this pin will output a <high> signal when both inputs receive a <high> signal.
PART_GATE_NOT_DESCRIPTION: A NOT gate. Its output will be on when its input is off.
PART_GATE_NOT_PIN_1_DESCRIPTION: When this part is active, this pin will output a <high> signal when the input is <low> and a <low> signal otherwise.
PART_BATTERY_DESCRIPTION: A battery which constantly outputs a high signal. Many parts need to be powered to function.
PART_BATTERY_PIN_DESCRIPTION: This pin will always output a <high> signal.
PART_WHEEL_PIN_0_DESCRIPTION: When a signal between <low> and <high> is provided, the motor will rotate counter clockwise with the intensity of that signal.
PART_WHEEL_PIN_2_DESCRIPTION: When a signal between <low> and <high> is provided, the motor will rotate clockwise with the intensity of that signal.
PART_WHEEL_PIN_BRAKES_DESCRIPTION: When a <high> signal is provided, the brakes will be active regardless of motor signals.
PART_SENSOR_TOUCH_DESCRIPTION: A touch sensor will output a positive signal while making contact with an object.
PART_SENSOR_TOUCH_PIN_DESCRIPTION: When the touch sensor hits something, a <high> signal pulse will be given.
PART_SENSOR_SONAR_DESCRIPTION: If an object is within the range of the sonar, this sensor will output a signal depending on the distance to that object.
PART_SENSOR_SONAR_PIN_DESCRIPTION: If an object is within range, this pin will output a signal ranging from <high> when it is directly in front of the sensor and <low> when it is at its maximum distance. When no object is within range, the output will be <low>.
PART_PROPELLER_PIN_DESCRIPTION: When a <high> signal is provided, the propeller will rotate and try to propel the craft towards the propeller direction.
PART_CONTROLLER_DESCRIPTION: A receiver for player controls. Keyboard or gamepad actions are received by this controller and can be used to control a machine.
PART_CONTROLLER_PIN_LEFT_DESCRIPTION: When the player steers the craft to the left, this pin will output a signal between <low> and <high> depending on how far the joystick moved.
PART_CONTROLLER_PIN_RIGHT_DESCRIPTION: When the player steers the craft to the right, this pin will output a signal between <low> and <high> depending on how far the joystick moved.
PART_CONTROLLER_PIN_UP_DESCRIPTION: When the player steers the craft up, this pin will output a signal between <low> and <high> depending on how far the joystick moved.
PART_CONTROLLER_PIN_DOWN_DESCRIPTION: When the player steers the craft down, this pin will output a signal between <low> and <high> depending on how far the joystick moved.
PART_CONTROLLER_PIN_ACTION_1_DESCRIPTION: When action key 1 is pressed, this pin will output a <high> signal
PART_CONTROLLER_PIN_ACTION_2_DESCRIPTION: When action key 2 is pressed, this pin will output a <high> signal
PART_CONTROLLER_PIN_ACTION_3_DESCRIPTION: When action key 3 is pressed, this pin will output a <high> signal
PART_BUTTON_DESCRIPTION: A button that can be pressed. While pressed, a signal will flow from its input to its output. When the button is not pressed, there is no connection between its pins.
PART_BUTTON_PIN_INPUT_DESCRIPTION: Any kind of signal can be connected to the input pin.
PART_BUTTON_PIN_OUTPUT_DESCRIPTION: While the button is pressed, this pin will output the input signal. If the button is not pressed, the output is <low>
PART_SWITCH_DESCRIPTION: A switch that can be toggled. While toggled on, a signal will flow from its input to its output. When the switch is off, there is no connection between its pins.
PART_SWITCH_PIN_INPUT_DESCRIPTION: Any kind of signal can be connected to the input pin.
PART_SWITCH_PIN_OUTPUT_DESCRIPTION: While the switch is on, this pin will output the input signal. If the switch is off, the output is <low>
PART_TRANSISTOR_DESCRIPTION: A transistor lets a signal flow from its collector to its emitter if power is supplied to its base.
PART_TRANSISTOR_PIN_COLLECTOR_DESCRIPTIO: Any kind of signal can be supplied to the collector. If power is supplied to the base, this signal will flow to the emitter.
PART_TRANSISTOR_PIN_BASE_DESCRIPTION: If a <high> signal is provided to the base, a signal will flow from the collector to the emitter
PART_TRANSISTOR_PIN_EMITTER_DESCRIPTION: If the base is powered, this pin outputs whatever signal is supplied to the collector. Otherwise, the output is <low>.
PART_METER_DESCRIPTION: If a signal is provided, the meters dial will show its current value.
PART_METER_PIN_INPUT_DESCRIPTION: Any signal provided to this pin will be measured.
PART_RESISTOR_DESCRIPTION: A resistor reduces a signals value by 50%.
PART_RESISTOR_PIN_INPUT_DESCRIPTION: Any signal connected to this resistor will be transformed.
PART_RESISTOR_PIN_OUTPUT_DESCRIPTION: The output signal will be half the input signal.
PART_ADDER_DESCRIPTION: An adder. The two input signals are summed and sent to the output pin. The output cannot be higher than a <high> signal.
PART_ADDER_PIN_1_DESCRIPTION: Both input signals summed together. The output cannot be higher than a <high> signal. If no power is supplied, this pin will output a <low> signal.
PART_ADDER_PIN_2_DESCRIPTION: The first input signal, which must be a value between <low> and <high>.
PART_ADDER_PIN_3_DESCRIPTION: The second input signal, which must be a value between <low> and <high>.
PART_CAPACITOR_DESCRIPTION: A capacitor charges while a signal is provided to its input. The capacitor will output its input signal when it is fully charged. When no input signal is provided, the capacitor will discharge.
PART_CAPACITOR_PIN_INPUT_DESCRIPTION: A signal to charge the capacitor with.
PART_CAPACITOR_PIN_OUTPUT_DESCRIPTION: When the capacitor is fully charged, the output signal will be equal to the input signal. Otherwise, the output signal will be <low>.
PART_ALTIMETER_DESCRIPTION: When powered, the output value of this sensor will relate to the height of this robot. At sea level, the output will be <low>. At 30 meters or more, the output will be <high>.
PART_ALTIMETER_PIN_OUTPUT_DESCRIPTION: The output will be <low> at sea level, <high> at 30 meters or higher, and increase linearly if the altitude is between these values. If the part is not powered, the output will be <low>.
PART_COMPARATOR_DESCRIPTION: Compare two signals with each other, and output a <high> signal if the second signal is bigger than the first one.
PART_COMPARATOR_PIN_1_DESCRIPTION: This pin will output a <high> signal if the second input pin value is higher than the first input pin value. If this part is not powered, this pin will output a <low> signal.
PART_TILT_DESCRIPTION: This sensor detects the degree of tilt the robot experiences
PART_TILT_PIN_OUTPUT_DESCRIPTION: When this part is powered, this pin will output the degree of tilt. If the robot is not tilted, the output will be halfway between <low> and <high>. When the robot is rotated 90 degrees to the left, the output will be <low>. When the robot is rotated 90 degrees to the right, the output will be <high>. When the part is not powered, the output will be <low>.
PART_SUBTRACTOR_DESCRIPTION: A subtractor. The second input is subtracted from the first one, and the result is sent to the output pin. The output cannot be lower than a <low> signal.
PART_SUBTRACTOR_PIN_1_DESCRIPTION: The second input signal subtracted from the first input signal. The output cannot be lower than a <low> signal. If no power is supplied, this pin will output a <low> signal.
PART_SUBTRACTOR_PIN_2_DESCRIPTION: The first input signal, which must be a value between <low> and <high>.
PART_SUBTRACTOR_PIN_3_DESCRIPTION: The second input signal, which must be a value between <low> and <high>.
